alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Renville; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 21 at 3:55AM CST until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Yellow Medicine, Renville and Chippewa Counties. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 885.0 feet, Flood waters begin to reach the alley way along the river at the foot bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 AM CST Sunday, the stage was 885.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 315 AM CST Sunday was 885.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected maintain its current level until the ice jam breaks. - Flood stage is 885.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 884.8 feet on 07/04/2013. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
